lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Tokyo and Washington are aware that nervous currency markets stand ready to bail out of dollars and buy yen, which economists fear could send world interest rates soaring and even lead to global recession.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Unless the Japanese prime minister brings with him measures to stimulate the Japanese economy by fiscal expansion or lower interest rates, the visit is likely to be considered by currency markets as an outright failure.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But the participation in the talks by Baker, the administration's top policy maker on international economic affairs, suggests that hard bargaining between the two sides may be in prospect.
